reviews.review_msg: Mattsson was such an unexpectedly nice prof- went in first day of class thinking I was gonna fail; I did not :) His exams are exactly as he says, a bit hard to follow lectures though just coz he's a really soft speaker + he gets a bit hung up on some topics sometimes (think it's a smart person thing) He's SUPER knowledgable and his dog hella cute

BISC 205 is a great course, but the plant side is pretty boring. Jim goes painfully into detail about plant growth and isn't very clear on what is expected for the exam. He has a strong accent and mumbles, making lectures difficult to understand (sit at the front). My best advice is to study well in advance for his exams. He also marks quite tough.

He is a very nice and caring man that cares for students. Howver, he is not the best prof. Very hard to hear and often had to interrupt during midterms and finals because students didnt understand his content. His format for mc isnt the best, and didnt give us a practice midterm as he, “procrastinates too”. If im paying for uni, I dont want this

The person who gave him a rating of 1 was likely a student who complains frequently. If you put in the time and effort to study, you'll definitely do well in the course. When I attended Professor Mattsson's office hours, he was friendly and took the time to explain difficult concepts, which really helped clarify my understanding.
Avoid

Impossible to understand. Didn't even attend lecture because it was pointless, ppl would get up and leave mid lecture. Tests r marked tediously and was nothing like review we were given. Seems like a very nice + knowledgable guy but it's just a shame you can't hear/understand a word he's saying. Very cute dog he brings to class sometimes!

lectures were all over the place. He taught so many complex processes and the midterm had the simplest stuff on it that you would tend to overlook while studying. Got tested on specific examples from the notes and none of the hard stuff was on it which was frustrating.

I really enjoyed Jim's lectures, they were clear straight forward and easy to listen to. Midterm was easy if you put effort into the course. His office hours + review sessions were very helpful as well, he will explain any concepts you dont understand. 

(Tutorials were annoying, but I dont think that was so much his fault but rather my ta)

Jim made this class really fun, despite the dry content. The assignments were very well designed. The notes had all the information needed for midterm & final exam. The tutorial assignments were great practice to prepare for the exams and ask any questions. Jim wanted all his students to do well and I highly recommend taking a class with him!

Would highly recommend. Lecture content is easy to do well in, its the labs that are more time consuming and difficult because of the lab instructor. Tests right from the notes, some questions are more applied, some more just explaining a process. Great notes, very fair and almost easy exams.

To do well: Read the lectures, prepare for labs, and study extra material that is given to you. Lectures were enjoyable, but not always necessary. Can't rely on textbook for help. Very little help outside of class, but try get some if you need it.
Material is tricky so need to keep up and understand fully! otherwise fair
Fair midterm and exam, just need to know the materials in the slides. Notes are easy to follow.

Amazing prof, actually cares about his class and wants us to learn. Really a passionate guy. Would take him again any time. Class is not easy, be prepared to work. Take this class if you want to learn. Lectures are recorded.

Jim is a great prof. He works with the class to move it to the direction we want to learn. He knows the material well, and is passionate about it.  He made attaining a good grade very achievable by working with him 1-on-1. If you get the chance to take this course with him, jump at it.

Mumbles during lecture so it's next to impossible to follow. Notes are brief and focuses on a lot "how" things. But tests on "why"...and everything is examable..especially the side notes or those things you think are irrelevant/not important. No textbook/recordings..just his brief notes and whatever notes you take. Great guy nonetheless though
Really unimpressed with the class. Dropped the course as soon as I realized he probably wouldn't get organized.

Dr. Mattsson is one of the best professors I have ever had. This course was was extremely interesting, and Dr. Mattsson was enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the subject. I would recommend this course and professor to anyone, and wish that I had the opportunity to take more classes taught by him.

He is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is very approachable and fair. Pay attention in the lecture. Office hrs: really helpful. Exams were fair, but the final exam was definitely harder than the midterm exam.

Lectures are definitely hard to follow since he goes off on tangents all the time. But despite this he's actually a very nice and approachable guy. Read the recommended text and listen in lecture! A very pretty interesting course. Up-scaled the final grade a lot. And yes, I do think he looks kind of cute.

very soft spoken, but if you listen carefully he has a quirky sense of humour and goes off on  wierd tangents making lectures pretty entertaining. Very fair - if he tells you to read the book - READ THE BOOK and you will be good to go.

Pretty easy class in. Mattsson is definitely a mumbler but his notes are well informed. Very understanding of students and willing to comprimise with their needs (ie: wants you to do well). Makes sure you know exactly what to expect when walking into an exam.

There was nothing wrong with his lectures, but his monotonous voice was the main reason I was prone to falling asleep during almost every lectures. Midterm was easy. Finals? I don't wanna talk about it.

Bring a translator.  I had no clue what he was saying half the time.  Know your plants!  Exams fair, although questions can be worded pretty oddly.  Would've ended up with a better mark if he hadn't down-scaled the exam before we had written it.  University politics baffle me.
difficult to follow.  You're never sure which part of development he's starting into in his lectures.  Exams are pretty fair though
really likes plants but otherwise really cool guy
He's a very nice and approachable professor.

Powerpoint slides too much text... doesn't explain things too clearly... very approachable despite the fact... willing to help... looks out for those who work hard... bad thing: DOESN'T KEEP APPOINTMENTS!!
Doesn't make scheduled appointments, however the exams are a lot easier than with most profs!
Intrested in material, simplifies lots of the material so everyone can understand but occasionally wanders on tangents (but you  don't need to know them) so overall good!
